body: r_c watches the vigil being held for m_c from the sidelines, not at all sure how {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/feel/feels} about {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} death.

r_c resented m_c for what {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} couldn't have, but seeing m_c's body lying in the clearing as the Clan hold vigil for {PRONOUN/m_c/object} makes {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} jealousy feel petty and stupid.
r_c has always felt jealous of m_c, but could never want to take {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} place now, watching the Clan holding vigil for {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.

r_c listens to the stories being passed around as the vigil for m_c continues, and stalks off to {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} nest. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} can't stand hearing everyone praise such a useless cat.
m_c really wasn't that great, but it's amazing how many cats want to ignore that now that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} dead, and r_c isn't interested in hearing it.

At the vigil for m_c, r_c snorts in frustration when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/realize/realizes} this is just another excuse for every cat to talk about how great {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/are/is}... or rather, {VERB/m_c/were/was}.
r_c looks down at m_c's limp body, feeling conflicted. Who will r_c measure {PRONOUN/r_c/self} against now? Their rivalry was bitter, but it also fueled r_c.
r_c is relieved when a Clanmate mentions what happened to m_c. At least now, no cat will compare them and find r_c wanting.
r_c feels sick with jealousy watching m_c's loved ones grieve {PRONOUN/m_c/object}. Would any cat care that much if {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} died?
r_c hated m_c for what {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} had that r_c didn't. Now that m_c is finally out of the way, maybe r_c will be able to live the life {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/want/wants}.
r_c seethes from the sidelines as {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} Clanmates line up at m_c's vigil to praise {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
With m_c gone, r_c feels able to breathe again.

r_c felt that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} spent so much of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} life in m_c's shadow, that now that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} dead, r_c can feel the sun on {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} pelt.
